docs.title: Welcome to The Titans v0.495 Unofficial Wiki
docs.text:
This documentation is dedicated to the "Almost there!" update (v0.495) for Minecraft 1.7.10. Use the navigation above or the quick links below to explore the mod's mechanics, bosses, and dimensions.

Project Scope

This wiki focuses specifically on the technical stats and survival strategies for version 0.495, known for the "You Reap What You Sow" mechanics and the introduction of the Nowhere.

Warning

This mod contains entities capable of crashing your game or banning you from your own world. Always maintain backups!

docs.title: Ores & Elements
docs.text: This section covers the various natural elements and alloys found in the world of The Titans. While some are common, others are essential for progressing toward Titan-slaying gear.

docs.title: Copper Ore
docs.text: Copper is the most abundant element added by the mod. While it is technically "weak," its value lies in its availability and its role in creating Bronze.

docs.title: 📊 Mining Statistics
docs.text: Property Value Average Vein Size 24 Blocks Max Height Y 256 Rarity Extremely Common (More common than Coal)

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage
docs.text:
• Early Game: Can be used to craft basic Copper tools and armor.
  • Tier Level: Roughly equivalent to Wood in terms of durability.
  • Alloying: Combine Copper with Tin to create Bronze, which is significantly more durable.

Evaluation

Copper is pretty useless on its own once you progress past the first few minutes of gameplay. Its primary purpose is to be farmed in bulk for industrial alloys.

docs.title: 🛠️ Metallurgy
docs.text: To advance your gear, use the following recipe logic: * Copper + Tin = Bronze

docs.title: Tin Ore
docs.text: Tin serves as the second "Beginner Ore" in the progression tree. While slightly more durable than Copper, it is best utilized when smelted into stronger alloys.

docs.title: 📊 Mining Statistics
docs.text: Property Value Average Vein Size 16 Blocks Max Height Y 256 Rarity Very Common (Found everywhere)

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage
docs.text:
• Early Game: Can be crafted into Tin tools and armor.
  • Tier Level: Offers slightly better durability than Copper, but still considered a "starter" tier.
  • Primary Use: Better used to create Bronze equipment rather than being used on its own.

Evaluation

Like Copper, Tin is pretty useless on its own for long-term survival. Its true value is unlocked once you begin the alloying process.

docs.title: Bronze (Alloy)
docs.text: Bronze is the first major upgrade for any player. It is highly valued in the early game because it is significantly more plentiful than Iron while providing superior performance to basic stone or early-game elements.

docs.title: ⚒️ Production Statistics
docs.text: Property Value Crafting Recipe 1x Copper Ingot + 1x Tin Ingot Plentitude More common than Iron (due to abundance of components) Utility Excellent early-game material

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage
docs.text:
• Superior Durability: Bronze has more durability than Copper and Tin combined.
  • Tier Level: Acts as a direct upgrade to Stone tools, but with much better efficiency and longevity.
  • Equipment: Can be crafted into a full suite of Bronze tools and armor.

The Perfect Starter Alloy

Bronze is really cool due to how you make it. It is an all-around better material than its components, allowing players to establish a solid gear set before diving into deeper mining expeditions.

docs.title: 💎 Chromium & Magnesium
docs.text:
Chromium and Magnesium are specialized ores that introduce players to advanced metallurgy. Unlike earlier ores, these two are physically interdependent; one is essentially useless without the other.

"Cool, shiny, but currently unusable."

docs.title: 📊 Mining Statistics
docs.text: Property Value Average Vein Size 8 Blocks Max Height Y 48 (Requires deeper mining) Interdependency High (Requires both to be of any use)

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage
docs.text:
• The Shiny Ingot Phase: On their own, Chromium and Magnesium can't do anything but sit in your inventory as "cool, shiny ingots."
  • Advanced Alloying: These two elements are the mandatory ingredients required to create Steel.

Interdependence

Don't bother mining one without the other. You need both Chromium and Magnesium in equal measure to progress into the Steel age of equipment.

docs.title: 🏗️ Steel (Alloy)
docs.text: Steel represents the transition into mid-to-late game power. It is an industrial-grade alloy that provides Diamond-tier protection and efficiency while being far more plentiful to produce.

docs.title: ⚒️ Production Statistics
docs.text: Property Value Crafting Recipe 1x Chromium + 1x Magnesium + 1x Iron + 1x Coal Plentitude More plentiful than Diamond Tier Level Diamond Grade (Mid-to-Late Game)

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage
docs.text:
• Toughness: Modeled after real-world structural steel used in buildings and cars, this material is incredibly durable.
  • Diamond Alternative: Steel can be used to craft tools and armor equivalent to Diamond grade in strength and mining level.
  • The Trade-off: While just as strong, Steel has slightly lower durability than Diamond:
    • Tools: -400 Durability compared to Diamond.
    • Armor: -80 Durability compared to Diamond.

The Architect's Choice

Steel is good for a reason. It is the go-to material for players who want Diamond-level power without the rarity of hunting for actual Diamonds.

docs.title: 🧊 Miscellaneous Elements (Unused)
docs.text:
The following ores generate in the world but currently serve no functional purpose in version 0.495. They are primarily for collection or potential future compatibility.

Ore Status Lead No current use Silver No current use Platinum No current use

Collector's Note

While these "don't have any use yet," it is often wise to hoard them in chests in case of future updates or cross-mod integration.

docs.title: 🌌 Harcadium (Element No. 753)
docs.text:
Harcadium is the cornerstone of The Titans mod. Known as the element that comprises the core of Ender Pearls, it is the only material capable of withstanding the raw power of a Titan.

"The Essence of the End"

docs.title: 📍 Location & Acquisition
docs.text:
Harcadium can be obtained through mining or as a reward for high-level combat:

  • The Overworld: Found at Layer 14 or lower. Generates in small veins of 1–4 blocks.
  • The End: Found in much greater density, appearing with frequency similar to Iron.
  • The Nowhere: The primary source of the element; the ground is literally littered with it.
  • Titan Drops: Slain Titans drop Harcadium in varying quantities. The stronger the Titan, the greater the drop.

docs.title: 📦 Material Forms
docs.text:
Harcadium exists in five condensed forms, allowing for versatile crafting and storage:

Form Usage Block Compact storage and structural use. Item (Ingot) The standard crafting component for tools and armor. Nugget Smaller denomination of Harcadium. Wafer Specialized industrial form. Waflet High-utility item. A ring of Waflets in a crafting table yields 64 Ender Pearls.

docs.title: ⚔️ Combat Utility
docs.text:
Harcadium is not just a material; it is a necessity for survival in version 0.495.

  • Anti-Titan Equipment: Used to craft the first tier of tools and armor capable of damaging Titans and resisting their unique damage types.
  • Minimum Requirement: As noted in earlier guides, Harcadium is the baseline for engaging any Titan in combat.

Worthiness Note

While Harcadium gear is powerful, it is merely the gateway to the Ultima Blade. Master this element before attempting to move higher.

docs.title: 🌑 Void Essence
docs.text:
"Protection over your physical body in exchange for your soul."

Void Essence is a tier above Harcadium, offering near-absolute protection at the cost of extreme volatility. It is the material of choice for those hunting Greater Titans and above.

"A volatile fragment of the abyss."

docs.title: ⚠️ Hazardous Properties
docs.text: The Void does not want to be contained. Handling this ore is a life-threatening task: * The Ore Block: Standing on a raw Void Ore block will kill the player instantly. * Mining Detonation: Breaking the ore causes a violent explosion immediately upon being mined. * The Condensed Block: Once crafted into a block, it will explode anything—mobs or players—that touches it.

docs.title: 📍 Location & Acquisition
docs.text:
Because of its rarity and danger, searching the Overworld is largely considered a waste of time.

Location Density & Notes The Overworld Layer 8 or lower. Generates in 0–2 blocks. Extremely rare. The End Much greater density, appearing roughly as often as Diamond. The Nowhere Relatively plentiful throughout the dimension. Titan Drops Only dropped by the strongest Titans in the mod.

docs.title: ⚔️ Equipment Potential
docs.text:
Void Essence is used to craft tools and armor that are stronger than Harcadium in every way.

  • Elite Anti-Titan Gear: Higher damage ceilings and superior damage reduction compared to Harcadium.
  • Soul Exchange: While it provides nearly unrivaled physical protection, the lore implies a heavy spiritual cost for the user.

Safety Protocol

When mining Void Essence, ensure you have a high level of Blast Resistance or use long-range mining tools. One misplaced click can result in immediate death and loss of items.

docs.title: Harcadium Equipment
docs.text: Harcadium gear is the "Great Equalizer." It is the minimum requirement for engaging any Titan below Greater status. Without this equipment, most Titans will ignore your attacks entirely.

docs.title: ⚔️ Harcadium Tools
docs.text:
All Harcadium tools feature Armor Piercing capabilities, allowing them to bypass the natural defenses of Giant Creatures.

Tool Normal Damage Giant Damage (Piercing) Unique Abilities Sword 50 500 Standard Anti-Titan weapon. Axe 49 450 Super-fast wood chopping. Pickaxe 48 400 Mines Obsidian in ~2 seconds. Shovel 47 350 Elite excavation speed. Hoe N/A 300 Tills gravel, mycelium, and dry sponge into farmland.

docs.title: 🏹 The Harcadium Bow & Arrows
docs.text:
Considered "Powerful as S$!&," this bow is a mandatory tool for keeping distance during Titan fights.

  • Armor Piercing: Deals 500 damage to Giant Creatures.
  • Anti-Wither: Completely ignores the Wither's special armored phase.
  • Recovery: Arrows can be retrieved even if they hit an entity.
  • Requirement: Requires Diamond String to craft.

docs.title: 🛡️ Harcadium Armor
docs.text: Crafted like standard armor but using Harcadium ingots. Each piece provides god-like status effects to the wearer.

docs.title: Individual Piece Buffs
docs.text:
• Helmet: Night Vision, Water Breathing.
  • Chestplate: Haste IV, Resistance IV, Strength X, Fire Resistance.
  • Leggings: Regeneration V.
  • Boots: Jump Boost II, Speed IV.

docs.title: 💎 Full Set Bonuses
docs.text:
When the complete set is worn, the player gains the following: * Absorption XL: Massive extra health that replenishes every 40 seconds. * Saturation XX: You will never need to eat again. * Aura: The wearer gives off a quiet, powerful hum.

Combat Threshold

Harcadium armor is the minimum requirement to survive hits from Lesser and Average Titans. Against Greater Titans or Gods, even this armor may fail.

docs.title: Absence Equipment (Void Tier)
docs.text: The Absence Set is the pinnacle of physical protection before reaching Admin-level gear. It is the minimum requirement for engaging any Titan classified as a God. Wearing this set exchanges your humanity for the raw, unbridled power of the Void.

docs.title: ⚔️ Absence Tools
docs.text:
These tools don't just "pierce" armor; they delete health bars. Each tool is a world-class implement of destruction.

Tool Damage Unique Abilities Absence Sword 1,500 The standard weapon for slaying God-tier Titans. Absence Axe 1,499 Absolute Wood Destruction; harvests forests in seconds. Absence Pickaxe 1,498 Instantly deletes Stone; mines Obsidian in < 1 second. Absence Shovel 1,497 Tier-leading excavation power.

docs.title: 💎 The Soul-Stealer (Absence Hoe)
docs.text: The Absence Hoe is arguably the most useful tool in the set due to its unique life-drain mechanic: * Damage: 1,500 * Soul Siphon: Striking small non-titan/non-player entities steals their soul. * Buffs: Heals the user and adds extra health and attack strength to your base stats. * Tilling: Inherits the Harcadium ability to till Gravel, Mycelium, and Dry Sponge.

docs.title: 🛡️ Absence Armor
docs.text: Crafted from Void Essence, this armor grants the wearer stats that mirror those of the Titans themselves.

docs.title: Individual Piece Buffs
docs.text:
• Helmet: Night Vision, Water Breathing.
  • Chestplate: Haste 100, Resistance IV, Strength 50, Fire Resistance.
  • Leggings: Regeneration 200 (Near-instant health recovery).
  • Boots: Jump Boost X, Speed XX.

docs.title: 🌑 The Transcendence (Full Set Bonus)
docs.text:
Wearing the complete Absence set transforms the player: * Health Ascension: Your health pool jumps from 10 hearts to a massive 210 hearts ($420 \text{ HP}$). * Absorption C: Massive extra health that replenishes every 40 seconds. * Saturation C: Absolute immunity to hunger. * Aura: The quiet hum of Harcadium is replaced by a deep, loud hum of the Void.

God-Tier Requirement

Do not attempt to fight a God-status Titan without this set. The 200+ hearts and Regeneration 200 are the only things standing between you and an instant "Ban" to the Nowhere.

docs.title: Adminium Armor: The Armor of the Gods
docs.text:
"If who ever wear this armor, if they be worthy, shall possess the power of the gods!"

Adminium is the absolute pinnacle of technology in The Titans. It is not crafted from mere stone, but from the fundamental bedrock of the universe itself. This is the only armor set in existence capable of withstanding Witherzilla's wrath.

docs.title: 🏗️ The Cost of Divinity
docs.text:
Crafting this set is a monumental task. It does not use standard Bedrock, but Compacted Bedrock.

  • Compacted Bedrock: Requires 9x Bedrock blocks to craft a single unit.
  • The "Price Tag": Since you need full suits and tools, the total Bedrock requirement is non-tupilled. You have a lot of Titan slaying ahead of you to gather this much material.
  • Durability: Practically unbreakable.

docs.title: ⚡ God-Like Attributes
docs.text: Equipping the Adminium set transcends the limits of a player, granting abilities usually reserved for the Titans themselves.

docs.title: Individual Piece Buffs
docs.text:
• Helmet: Night Vision, Water Breathing.
  • Chestplate: Haste 100, Resistance IV, Strength 50, Fire Resistance.
  • Leggings: Regeneration 200.
  • Boots: Jump Boost XV, Speed XV.

docs.title: 🌌 Full Set: Divine Presence
docs.text: When the full set is equipped, your very presence becomes a weapon: * Massive Health: Your health pool expands from 10 hearts to a staggering 410 hearts ($820 \text{ HP}$). * The Killing Aura: Automatically kills every non-allied entity within a 16-block radius. * Titan Traversal: Jumping causes a Titan-like Earthquake. If mobGriefing is enabled, you will literally drill a hole through the Earth. * Regeneration: Includes Absorption 100 (replenishes every 40s), Healing X, and Saturation 100. * The Hum: Gives off a very noticeable, loud hum that signals your arrival.

docs.title: ⚒️ Adminium Tools
docs.text:
Adminium tools represent the ultimate tier of utility and damage. * Construction: Crafted using regular Bedrock for the hilts and Compacted Bedrock for the main components.

Witherzilla Protocol

Adminium Armor is the absolute minimum requirement to engage Witherzilla. Any other armor—including the Absence set—will be shredded by the God of Titans in seconds.

docs.title: 🗡️ The Ultima Blade
docs.text:
"The largest weapon to ever be wielded by a mortal, this puppy is sentient in its own right."

The Ultima Blade is not just a tool; it is a sentient entity that judges its wielder. It is the only weapon capable of striking down the highest-tier Titans, though it comes with a personality of its own.

"If you are worthy, you shall be a God. If not, you are nothing."

docs.title: ⚡ Divine Statistics
docs.text: Attribute Value Attack Damage 100,000 Durability Infinite (Indestructible) Reach Significantly extended range Special Ignores all forms of damage restrictions and armor

docs.title: 🧠 Sentience & Mechanics
docs.text:
The Blade is "smart" and actively protects its wielder—provided they are worthy.

  • Soul Bind: Upon hitting your first entity with the Blade, the game rule keepInventory is automatically set to true. The Blade ensures you will never lose it.
  • The Judgment: The Blade judges its user. If you are found unworthy, it may refuse to function or even judge you for your actions in Creative Mode.
  • The "Kill" Logic: While it deals 100,000 damage, some Titans have specific stun requirements or "Spirit" mechanics that prevent a one-shot kill. Read the Titan profiles carefully.

docs.title: 🔍 Right-Click Abilities
docs.text:
The Blade acts as a sensory organ for the player, allowing you to detect hidden objects in the world:

  • Ore Detection (Right-Click): Scans the nearby area for valuable ores and announces their location.
  • Mob Tracking (Shift + Right-Click): Detects nearby hidden monsters and entities.

docs.title: ❓ How to Obtain
docs.text:
The Ultima Blade cannot be crafted.

The Creator's Secret

"I'll leave it up to you guys to figure out how you get this in survival. That's something for you to figure out. Until then, have plenty of fun with it in creative (if you're worthy for even that)."

Worthiness Check

In version 0.495, a new system was added that checks the player's "Worthiness." If you attempt to use the blade and fail the check, it will not perform its God-slaying duties.

docs.title: Nightmare Mode
docs.text:
"Sudden death."

Extreme Difficulty

As the name implies, Nightmare Mode makes life in Minecraft significantly harder. This mode is designed only for players who have mastered the base mechanics of The Titans mod.

Survival Tip

Attempting Nightmare Mode without a full set of Adminium Armor or better is almost certain suicide. Ensure your world is backed up before enabling this setting, as the increased explosion size can cause severe world griefing.

docs.title: ⚙️ Configuration
docs.text:
• Default Status: false
  • Activation: Must be manually set to true in the mod's configuration file.

docs.title: Hostile Titan Buffs
docs.text:
When Nightmare Mode is active, all hostile Titans receive massive stat increases. These buffs make even "Lesser" Titans a threat to endgame players.

Attribute Nightmare Multiplier Health 2x Total HP Attack Damage 3x Base Damage

docs.title: Witherzilla Special Buffs
docs.text: Witherzilla receives unique, world-ending enhancements in this mode: - Fiery Explosions: All explosive attacks now ignite the surrounding area. - Increased Blast Radius: Explosions are significantly larger, capable of wiping out massive structures in a single strike.

docs.title: Titan Spirits
docs.text:
"A Titan never truly dies; it only waits."

Mechanic Overview

The Titan Spirit is the ethereal form a Titan takes before manifesting in the corporeal realm or after its physical body has been "defeated". In this state, they are the ultimate predators of the spirit world.

docs.title: Spiritual Attributes
docs.text: Property Effect Invulnerability Completely immune to all forms of harm. Soul Drain Anything entering the Spirit's aura has its soul life force drained (other Titans are immune). Status Non-corporeal / Ethereal.

docs.title: 1. Seeking a Vessel
docs.text:
Titan Spirits search for a nearby host to make their vessel. They cannot interact with the physical world indefinitely and must find a compatible host: * Standard Titans: Must find and make contact with a Templar. * Witherzilla: Requires a Player to act as its vessel.

Once contact is made, the Titan officially returns to the corporeal realm and can be harmed as normal.

docs.title: 2. Post-Defeat Behavior
docs.text: When a Titan is defeated, the Spirit leaves the area by ascending into the sky: * The Ascension: Upon reaching Y 256, it teleports into a very far away chunk. * The Stalker: Alternatively, it can return to vengefully kill the player or stalk them until a compatible Templar shows up.

docs.title: ⚠️ Survival Warning
docs.text:
Because Spirits can relocate and reappear, you might encounter the same Titan you had fought and killed several times.

Base Longevity

Don't trust in your base's longevity, because it has none. If a Titan Spirit follows you home and finds a vessel, no structure can protect you from its return.

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
• Titans are God-like entities that exist outside our reality, coming in only to have lots of fun. Some few Titans come in for conquest, but most are just messing around, or search for reasons to flatten stuff (ie: bats and squids). Most of them spawn naturally are usually resting and waiting, only awakening when a player disturbs them.

  • All Titans have the ability to spawn smaller versions of themselves, with some Titans even having Loyalists, Priests, Zealots and Templars. Witherzilla spawns his minions from his head (literally), as does the Snow and Iron Golem titans, the Ender Colossus makes his teleport in, the Blaze Titan forges his from his body, and the rest raise their minions from the ground, no matter what the material. Some have their own special minions, too.

  • Titans have multiple ways of spawning into the world. The most common way is natural spawning, which works like structure generation, and thus, this method is always reliable, but finite. The second method is a Templar turning into a Titan through contact with the ethereal plain with their supernatural powers. The third is if a Titan Spirit takes over a Templar, which any Titan Spirit will attempt. The final method is through growth serum, which is player managed.

Titans also have a last resort ability they all can use. * When and if they feel they've got the right opportunity, they will start a "Re-growth" process where the Titan will start to shrink until it's the size of its normal counterpart, at which point it begins to grow again.This resets the Titan's entire health pool, meaning you'll have to start from scratch. The trick to preventing this is to kill the Titan quickly!

docs.title: Things relating to all Titans:
docs.text:
• They don't despawn (like Ender Dragons)
  • They have a damage cap of 1000 (500 on Nightmare), and have a hurt cooldown of 1.5 seconds
  • They are immune to most damage
  • Their numbers are limited to your loaded chunks, unless spawned through other means
  • Titans can't despawn on peaceful, aren't affected by the butcher command, and are immune to instant kill methods
  • They can and will divide you by zero
  • You must hit their hitbox base (bug with Minecraft in general), unless using projectiles
  • Their attacks destroy armor of all types
  • They'll deal damage to you even if you have super armor, resistance V or creative mode
  • They're all immune to fire and lava, and sink in all liquids, but can't drown
  • Non-armor piercing attacks do very little damage to them due to their abnormally high armor ratings (21 for Lesser Titans, 22 for Average, 23 for Greater, 24 for God)
  • If Titans are attacked by something that does less than 20 damage, they aren't affected by it at all.
  • Titans react to being hit by anything (even creative mode players), and it can be very hard to loose them
  • When it comes to doing battles, Titans have the attention span of a fly if anything they normally auto attack is in their line of sight
  • Titan on Titan fights are awesome to watch, especially on the Mob battle version due to the minions having mini battles all around them

  • Break the 4th wall

  • Titans are the only mobs in minecraft that are truly invulnerable. Yes, they can be killed, but upon disappearing, the REAL titan goes flying away into the sky. This is the fabled TITAN SPIRIT!

docs.title: The Omegafish
docs.text:
"The Underdog of the Titans"

Titan Profile

  • Classification: Lesser Titan Lesser Titan
  • Status: Active
  • Healing Factor: Low (Compared to higher tiers)

docs.title: 📊 Statistics
docs.text: Attribute Value Health 8,000 (4,000 ❤️) Armor Value High (Requires Harcadium-tier or better) Speed Extremely High (Burrowing)

docs.title: Primary Attacks
docs.text:
• Head Butt: Deals 50 damage.
  • Tail Swipe: Deals 50–200 damage depending on proximity.
  • Lightning Shot: Fires a bolt that deals 50 damage + Fire/Burning.
  • Tail Smash: Heavy strike dealing 400 damage.
  • Body Slam: Massive impact dealing 500 damage.
  • Anti-Titan Attack: Applies only to titans, deals around 500 damage

Enraged Phase

Once the Omegafish drops below 1/4 health, it will begin causing random explosions at the player's feet. Stay mobile to avoid instant death.

docs.title: The Burrowing Mechanic
docs.text: The Omegafish can burrow into the ground to close the distance instantly. * Invulnerability: While burrowed, this Titan is immune to all damage types. * Bug Note: In some early pre-builds of 0.49, a bug could cause the Omegafish to remain permanently invulnerable if it was hit while transitioning into a burrow.

docs.title: Minions:
docs.text: The Omegafish is never alone. It will constantly summon its minions: * Silverfish Loyalists: Basic fodder. Attacks everything their particular Titan would attack, even if the Titan isn't visibly there. * Silverfish Priests: Support units. Heal nearby injured allies. * Silverfish Zealots: Aggressive attackers. Capable of performing super-human feats such as sprinting really fast, jumping higher than normal, taking more injures than it's possible to sustain, and killing entities many times bigger than themselves. * Silverfish Bishop: They bring down judgement from the heavens onto the enemies of their titan. * Silverfish Templar: Tanky defenders. The most complicated and powerful of the five types. They are capable of levitation, are immune to fire and poison, and have extremely high resistance to magic damage. They also alternate between their normal mode of attack, and special random ranged attacks. Their is a list for all of these random attacks for each Templar linked here

docs.title: 🎒 Strategy & Loot
docs.text:
Equipment Check

Do not fight this Titan in Diamond Armor. Even as the "weakest" Titan, its Body Slam (500 damage) and other attacks will ignore most vanilla protections. You MUST use Harcadium as it is the minimum requirement of fighting all Titans

docs.title: How to Defeat
docs.text:
1. The Stun: You cannot melee it safely at first. Use Harcadium Arrows to chip away at it.
  2. The Flop: Once it sustains enough damage, it will "flop" over, becoming stunned.
  3. The Finishing Move: This is your chance to use your titan-slaying tools for maximum damage. Keep in mind it won't stay stunned forever

docs.title: Taming the Beast
docs.text: Unlike Witherzilla, the Omegafish can be subdued. 1. Stun the Omegafish. 2. Right-click with a Golden Apple. 3. If successful, you can mount and control this Titan.

docs.title: Notable Drops
docs.text:

docs.title: Witherzilla
docs.text:
World-Ending Entity

Witherzilla in v0.495 is capable of crashing servers and breaking chunks/freezing time. Always backup your world before spawning!

Fun Fact

The Omegafish is technically the "weakest" Titan that has it's own spirit, but it can still pack a punch! It is considered the underdog of the Titan's
